H0.text: Peripheral nervous system is the second of the nervous systemâ€™s two main parts, the other being the central nervous system.

H1.text: Functional nervious system is the second main part of the nervous system, alongside the central nervous system.

H2.text: Useful nervous system is the other main part of the nervous system besides the central nervous system.

H3.text: The obsolete nervous system is the second main part of the nervous system, the other part being the central nervous system.

A4.text: The peripheral nervous system (PNS) is one of two components that make up the nervous system of bilateral animals, with the other part being the central nervous system (CNS).

A5.text: The peripheral nervous system (PNS) consists of nerves and ganglia, which lie outside the brain and the spinal cord.
